content: find this too confusing you could always work the toe plain in just one of the colours round 1 work 16 sts in stripe place marker k1 ssk still in stripe colour sequence work across top according to chart until 1 st before sole k2tog k1 place second marker work to centre back in stripe decreased 2 sts round 2 work round without decreasing round 3 work to 1 st after first marker slipping marker as you get to it ssk work to 3 st before second marker k2tog k1 sl marker work to end of round decreased 2 sts repeat rounds 2 and 3 until you have 62 sts in total round 4 work round without decreasing round 5 work to 3 sts before first marker k2tog k1 sl marker k1 ssk work to 3 sts before sec- ond marker k2tog k1 sl marker k1 ssk work to end of round decreased 4 sts repeat rounds 4 and 5 until you have 42 sts in total work only round 5 until you have 18 sts left work to first marker slip the remaining sts on needle 1 onto a dpn then slip the sts up to the sec- ond marker on needle 2 onto the same needle move the remaining sts on needle 2 and the first sts from needle 1 onto a second dpn you should now have 9 sts on each dpn all sole sts on one and all instep sts on the other if you knit your colourwork from the inside to keep the floats long you are already set otherwise turn your sock inside out so you have the floats on the outside using a third dpn close the top with a 3 needle bind off as follows ideally using the darker of your two colours k one st from the front needle together with one st from the back needle knit the next sts on your left needles together in the same way so you have 2 sts on your right needle pull the first st over the second casting the st off continue to knit 2 sts together from the 2 needles on the left and casting one st off on the right needle until all sts are used up and you are left with one st on the needle break your yarn and pull the tail through that last st sew in all remaining yarn ends and start from the of heels and toes if you prefer for a short row heel omit all the gusset instructions and just continue working the chart in the round straight after the heel you could easily re-arrange the order of
